title: Rescued UK tech start-up Blippar replaces chief executive and founder
text:
The controversial founder of tech firm Blippar has stepped aside as chief executive, nine months after it collapsed into administration and was rescued by property mogul Nick Candy.

Ambarish Mitra, who founded the so-called augmented reality company in 2011 and at one stage claimed to have turned down a $1.5bn (£1.2bn) offer to buy it, will be replaced by former Skype executive Faisal Galaria. He will remain at the business as chief product officer.

Blippar developed an augmented reality app which allows users to search for information on real-world objects through their smartphone camera, as well as for making advertising and games for brands.
